2. Maternal disomy 15 refers to a condition where a person has two copies of chromosome 15 from their mother, instead of one copy from each parent. This can occur due to a genetic error during meiosis, the process by which gametes (sperm or egg cells) are formed.
3. Trisomy 15 is a condition where a person has three copies of chromosome 15, instead of the usual two copies. This can occur due to a genetic error during meiosis or mitosis, the process by which cells divide. Trisomy 15 is often associated with severe developmental delays, intellectual disability, and other health problems.
